elements.title: Saturn popular in fiction (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that the visual appeal of its rings (pictured) has made Saturn popular in fiction?

elements.title: Martin Research (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that for an additional US$25, Martin Research shipped its 1975 book on microcomputers with an Intel 8008?

elements.title: diginets (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that the 2017 acquisition of Katz Broadcasting by the E. W. Scripps Company was seen as a validation of the business of diginets?

elements.title: Poe Fire (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that aircraft helping to fight the Poe Fire in northern California in September 2001 were grounded by the FAA following the September 11 attacks?

elements.title: Trust (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that Elvis Costello and the Attractions were consistently intoxicated during the recording of the album Trust?

elements.title: Shelton Hotel (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that in the 1970s, the Shelton Hotel avoided demolition after seven elderly residents and a secretary refused to move out?

elements.title: Minuscule 1689 (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that Minuscule 1689, a Greek minuscule manuscript of the New Testament, went missing for nearly 100 years after it was moved during World War I?

elements.title: Greg Noire (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that Greg Noire aims to "de-concert" his concert photography?
